inputs.name: Long Trades
inputs.tooltip: Turn on/off long trades. Perhaps you are overall bearish and wish to exempt long trades on this asset

inputs.name: Short Trades
inputs.tooltip: Turn on/off short trades. Perhaps you are overall bullish and wish to exempt long trades on this asset

inputs.name: Hide welcome message (READ TOOLTIP)
inputs.tooltip: By click this you will activate this strategy, allowing you access to all the features and at the same time agreeing with terms of use found here : https://davidd.tech/terms/. Davidd and Davidd.Tech strategies are for educational purposes and can not be taken responsible for any losses.

inputs.name: Optimiser MODE 🚀
inputs.tooltip: Enable Optimiser MODE to hide all graphics and speed up the optimization process.

inputs.name: Trade type
inputs.tooltip:
Choose the trade type for your strategy.

NORMAL: Enter trades when no other trades are active.

Hedge Mode: Allows two trades in opposite directions.

Pyramiding Mode: Takes all signals up to the specified maximum trades.

inputs.name: Use Limit exit
inputs.tooltip: Turns on/off the limit exit method. eg: using trail and not setting a limit exit. Must use trail, or strategy has no exit criteria

inputs.name: Allow Reversal Trades
inputs.tooltip: Allows a reversal trade. eg. flipping short from a long pos. False will isolate trades from one another, while true allows an opposite bias entry while in a position already

inputs.name: Close trade on reverse strategy
inputs.tooltip: Allows a reversal trade. eg. flipping short from a long pos. False will isolate trades from one another, while true allows an opposite bias entry while in a position already

inputs.name: Wait for confirmation of new entry on reversal
inputs.tooltip: Allows a reversal trade. eg. flipping short from a long pos. False will isolate trades from one another, while true allows an opposite bias entry while in a position already

inputs.name: Wait for isBarConfirmed?
inputs.tooltip: Enable this option to wait for the last tick to confirm on the bar.

inputs.name: ============ MAIN STRATEGY SETTING START ============
inputs.tooltip: Anything below this line until the next break is considered exclusive to this strategy. Each strategy is different and this is the area where the different indicators are changed outside of the boilerplate.

inputs.name: Type of Take Profit
inputs.tooltip:
Fixed Percentage - A hard stop loss set at a fixed percentage.

R:R - Risk to Reward ratio calculated with the stop loss.

Structure HH/LL - Refers to using the highest high (HH) or lowest low (LL) of the price structure as a reference for setting the take profit level.

Structure High/Low - Similar to Structure HH/LL, this approach includes considering higher highs (HH), lower lows (LL), higher lows (HL), and lower highs (LH) of the price structure.

PIPS - A standardized unit for measuring price movements in the forex market.

Mean - Refers to mean reversion, a trading strategy based on the assumption that prices tend to revert to their average or mean value over time.

inputs.name: Type of Stoploss
inputs.tooltip:
Choose the type of stop loss for your exit strategy.

None: No stop loss.

Fixed Percent: Set a hard stop loss at a fixed percentage.

ATR: Use the Average True Range (ATR) indicator to determine the stop loss.

HH/LL: Use the closest higher high (for short trades) or lower low (for long trades) to set the stop loss.

PIPS: Set the stop loss in terms of a fixed number of pips.

Chande Kroll, Keltner, Bollinger Bands, Donchian Channel: Use the lower or upper band of the respective indicator to set the stop loss.

MA #1, MA #5: Set the stop loss based on the value of Moving Average #1 or Moving Average #5.

Stop Loss Indicator: Use a specific stop loss indicator for setting the stop loss.

Mean: Set the stop loss based on the mean value of the asset.

Custom: Define a custom stop loss depending on your strategy.

inputs.name: Ignore Wicks -- Read Tooltip 🛟
inputs.tooltip:
Enable this option to only exit a trade if the bar's close price is below the stop loss.

Note: This approach can be risky and may not work with certain API connector services.

Please note that it will work with SimpleBot, but you need to deactivate the 'Use safety SL/TP' setting for compatibility.

inputs.name: Ignore Wicks Protection SL %
inputs.tooltip:
Set the maximum threshold that the wick must not pass when using the 'Ignore Wicks' option.

Note: The wick refers to the price movement outside the body of the candlestick.

Specify the threshold as a percentage value.

inputs.name: Stop Loss Long %
inputs.tooltip: Set the percentage value for the stop loss in long trades.

inputs.name: Take Profit Long %
inputs.tooltip: Set the percentage value for the take profit in long trades.

inputs.name: Stop Loss Short %
inputs.tooltip: Set the percentage value for the stop loss in short trades.

inputs.name: Take Profit Short %
inputs.tooltip: Set the percentage value for the take profit in short trades.

inputs.name: Stop Loss Long PIPS
inputs.tooltip: Set the number of pips for the stop loss in long trades.

inputs.name: Take Profit Long PIPS
inputs.tooltip: Set the number of pips for the take profit in long trades.

inputs.name: Stop Loss Short PIPS
inputs.tooltip: Set the number of pips for the stop loss in short trades.

inputs.name: Take Profit Short PIPS
inputs.tooltip: Set the number of pips for the take profit in short trades.

inputs.name: Indicator Source - SL L🟢
inputs.tooltip: Select the indicator source for the stop loss in long trades.

inputs.name: Indicator Source - SL S🔴
inputs.tooltip: Select the indicator source for the stop loss in short trades.

inputs.name: Highest High lookback
inputs.tooltip: Set the lookback period to find the highest high in the price structure.

inputs.name: Lowest Low Lookback
inputs.tooltip: Set the lookback period to find the lowest low in the price structure.

inputs.name: Profit factor Long (Risk to Reward)
inputs.tooltip: R:R (Risk to Reward) is used by default for ATR and HH/LL

inputs.name: Profit factor Short (Risk to Reward)
inputs.tooltip: R:R (Risk to Reward) is used by default for ATR and HH/LL

inputs.name: Left Bars
inputs.tooltip: Set the number of candles to look left to find a local high or low.

inputs.name: Right Bars
inputs.tooltip: Set the number of candles to look right to validate a local high or low.

inputs.name: ATR Multiplier For Stoploss
inputs.tooltip: Set the multiplier to determine the ATR-based stop loss. ATR (Average True Range) is a dynamic indicator that can be used to set a stop loss.

inputs.name: ATR Source
inputs.tooltip: Choose the source for calculating the ATR. Select 'Swing High/Low' to base it on swing highs and lows, or 'Source' to use the selected source.

inputs.name: Source Upper ATR Stoploss
inputs.tooltip: Select the upper source for calculating the ATR-based stop loss.

inputs.name: Source Lower ATR Stoploss
inputs.tooltip: Select the lower source for calculating the ATR-based stop loss.

inputs.name: ATR Swing lookback
inputs.tooltip: Set the lookback period for swing highs and lows when using the 'Swing High/Low' option as the ATR source.

inputs.name: Use Trailing Stop
inputs.tooltip: Enable this option to activate a trailing stop loss. The stop loss will dynamically adjust as the trade progresses.

inputs.name: Trailing Stop Source
inputs.tooltip: Select the source for calculating the trailing stop. Choose from options like 'High/Low', 'Close', 'Open', and specific indicators like 'Chande Kroll', 'Keltner', 'Bollinger Bands', or 'Donchian Channel'.

inputs.name: When to Activate Trailing?
inputs.tooltip: Choose when to activate the trailing stop. Options include 'Instant', 'After Hit Threshold %', 'After Hit TP 1', and 'After Hit TP 2'.

inputs.name: Trigger Trailing Threshold % of Total TP
inputs.tooltip: Set the threshold percentage of the total take profit to trigger the trailing stop. When the specified percentage is reached, the trailing stop will be activated.

inputs.name: Use Trailing Take Profit
inputs.tooltip: Enable this option to use trailing take profit. As the final take profit is hit, the trailing stop loss will continue to follow until it reverses.

inputs.name: ATR Trailing Stop Multiplier
inputs.tooltip: Set the multiplier for determining the size of the ATR-based trailing stop.

inputs.name: decimals points
inputs.tooltip: Manually round to max decimal points. This will help with more accuracy between you and your exchange.

inputs.name: Wait X Candles Between Entries
inputs.tooltip: Always wait X candles between entries. Set to below 0 to ignore.

inputs.name: Set Max Candles in Trade
inputs.tooltip: Enable the max number of candles in a trade

inputs.name: Max Candles
inputs.tooltip: Set the max number of candles in a trade. Please allow for one candle close after to close the trade.

inputs.name: Set Max Total DrawDown
inputs.tooltip: Enables max drawdown protection. Enabling this will stop the bot if the overall strategy drawdown drops below the defined risk appetite

inputs.name: Max Drawdown (%)
inputs.tooltip: Risk appetite. Every strategy sees downside. This is how much you could stomach to allow the bot to lose if you let it run. Strategy stops taking trades below this level

inputs.name: Set Max Intraday Loss
inputs.tooltip: Enable this option to set a maximum intraday loss limit for risk management.

inputs.name: Max Intraday Loss (%)
inputs.tooltip: Set the maximum percentage of intraday loss allowed. If the loss exceeds this limit, further trading for the day will be stopped.

inputs.name: Set Max Consecutive Days with Losses
inputs.tooltip: Enable this option to set a maximum number of consecutive days with losses. If the maximum limit is reached, trading will be paused until the consecutive loss streak is broken.

inputs.name: Max Consecutive Days with Losses
inputs.tooltip: The purpose of this rule is to cancel all pending orders, close all open positions and stop placing orders after a specified number of consecutive days with losses. The rule affects the whole strategy.

inputs.name: Percent or Fixed
inputs.tooltip:
Choose the position sizing method: 
- 'Percent': Use a fixed percentage of your portfolio for each trade. 
- 'Percent of initial account (Fixed Amount)': Use a fixed amount from your initial account balance for each trade, e.g., Initial portfolio: $1000 / 10% = $100 per trade. 
- 'Risk Based': Adjust position size based on risk management parameters.

inputs.name: % of Portfolio
inputs.tooltip: Set the percentage of your portfolio to risk per trade. This determines the position size based on your portfolio value. NOTE: The is the base for all other calculations.

inputs.name: Leverage
inputs.tooltip: Set the leverage ratio to be applied to your position size. Adjusting leverage can amplify potential returns and risks in your trading strategy.

inputs.name: Dynamic Leverage (READ TOOLTIP)
inputs.tooltip:
This will dynamically set your leverage to the risk ajusted to the highest possible amount. EXTREME RISKY! 
 Wiggle room subtracts this number from the leverage to ensure you are never above the max amount.
 MAX : MAX leverage to use. 
 Wiggle : Wiggle room to not get liquidated 
 RISK : % of the % to Risk. 
 Calculation : RISK/SL*MAINTENANCE_MARGIN_RATE

inputs.name: Show Liquadation line (BETA)
inputs.tooltip:
This will just add a reference line to the graph and will not be detect by backtesting.
 This is for reference only as it will depend on the PAIR and the calculation used by your exchange.

inputs.name: Block Trades if Liquadation is before SL (BETA)
inputs.tooltip:
This will block any trades where the RISK_LEVERAGE line is below/above the Stop loss, 
 Note this can only be estimated as the trade has not taken place.

inputs.name: Maintenance Margin Rate
inputs.tooltip: I suggest finding out your Maintenance Margin Rate before using any algo that could be effected by the leverage calculation.

inputs.name: Position Size (BETA)
inputs.tooltip: In alerts you can use #margin#, this will be replaced by tradingview. I did a full youtube video about this called 'Double your profits' For more information : https://youtu.be/4PB227Y_3CY

inputs.name: DA Source
inputs.tooltip: Select the source for the dynamic position size algorithm.

inputs.name: DA 3
inputs.tooltip:
This uses an exclusive algo from daviddtech to dynamically set your position amount. 
 For more information : https://youtu.be/4PB227Y_3CY

inputs.name: Use Martingale?
inputs.tooltip: Enable this option to use Martingale or Anti-Martingale position sizing. Martingale is a position sizing strategy where the position size is doubled on every loss. Anti-Martingale is a strategy where the position size is doubled on every win. BE AWARE! This will also activate the position size in daviddtech bot.

inputs.name: Martingale Multipler
inputs.tooltip:
The Martingale Multipler parameter determines the multiplier used in the Martingale position sizing strategy.

In the context of this strategy, Martingale is a position sizing technique where the position size is doubled on every loss. The Martingale Multipler value represents the factor by which the position size is increased after each losing trade.

For example, if Martingale Multipler is set to 2, the position size will be doubled after each loss.

It is important to exercise caution when using Martingale, as it can lead to significant drawdowns and increased risk. Consider implementing proper risk management techniques and assessing the overall risk-reward profile of your trading strategy.

inputs.name: Use DCA.
inputs.tooltip: Enable this option to use Dollar Cost Averaging (DCA) orders. DCA is a strategy where additional orders are placed at predetermined price levels to average the entry price of a position.

inputs.name: Max no. of safe orders
inputs.tooltip: This is the total number of Safety Orders the bot is allowed to use per deal that is opened.

inputs.name: Divide position by Max no. of safe orders
inputs.tooltip: Enable this option to divide the position size by the maximum number of safety orders. Each DCA order will have a fraction of the original position size.

inputs.name: Safety order step scale 🛟
inputs.tooltip:
The Safety Order Step Scale is used to multiply the Price Deviation percentage used by the last Safety Order placed on the exchange account.

Using a larger value here will reduce the amount of Safety Orders your bot will require to cover a larger move in price in the opposite direction to the active deal's take profit target.

inputs.name: Safety order volume scale 🛟
inputs.tooltip: The Safety Order Volume Scale is used to multiply the amount of funds used by the last Safety Order that was created.

inputs.name: Price deviation to open safety orders (%)
inputs.tooltip: Enter the percentage difference in price to create the first Safety Order. All Safety Orders are calculated from the price the initial Base Order.

inputs.name: Activate Threshold Risk:Reward?
inputs.tooltip: Activate this option to enforce a minimum risk-to-reward ratio for your trades.

inputs.name: Threshold Risk:Reward
inputs.tooltip: Set the minimum risk-to-reward ratio threshold. Trades with a risk-to-reward ratio below this threshold will be affected according to your risk management rules.

inputs.name: Activate Minimum TP %?
inputs.tooltip: Activate this option to set a minimum take profit as a percentage. If activated, the take profit level must reach the specified percentage, or the TP level will be replaced or the trade ignored. This helps filter out small non-profitable trades when using techniques like FIB pulls to set TP levels.

inputs.name: What if TP is too small ?
inputs.tooltip: Select the behavior when the TP is too small. 'Do not enter' will prevent the trade from being taken, while 'Use Percentage Instead' will replace the tp with the specified percentage.

inputs.name: Min Threshold TP %
inputs.tooltip: Set the minimum threshold for the take profit percentage. Trades with a take profit below this threshold will be affected according to your risk management rules.

inputs.name: Activate Max SL %
inputs.tooltip: Activate this option to set a maximum stop loss as a percentage.

inputs.name: What if threshold SL breaks ?
inputs.tooltip: Select the behavior when the stop loss threshold is broken. 'Do not enter' will prevent the trade from being taken, while 'Use Percentage Instead' will replace the stop loss with the specified percentage.

inputs.name: Threshold Max % SL
inputs.tooltip: Set the maximum stop loss percentage. If the dynamically calculated stop loss exceeds this percentage, it will either prevent the trade from being taken (based on the selection in 'What if threshold SL breaks ?') or replace the stop loss with this percentage.

inputs.name: Close Position Early if Price Crosses MA?
MA Protection Type
inputs.tooltip:
Enable this option to close the position early if the price crosses a moving average (MA). 

Select the type of moving average (MA) to use for the early exit protection or use Indicator Source to use and external indicator below.

inputs.name: MA Protection Length
inputs.tooltip: Set the length of the moving average (MA) for the early exit protection.

inputs.name: Indicator Source - Protection
inputs.tooltip: Select the indicator source for the protection. Please be careful not to add indicators that can repaint.

inputs.name: Move to Breakeven
inputs.tooltip:
Choose the move to breakeven parameter allows you to choose the logic for moving a trade to breakeven.

- Multi TP: Selecting this option will move the trade to breakeven when the first take profit target is hit.

- MULTI TP - Second TP: This option moves the trade to breakeven when the second take profit target is reached.

- SINGLE TP: With this option, the trade will be moved to breakeven when a certain percentage level is reached from the entry line. For example, setting it to 1% would trigger the move to breakeven when the entry moves 1% into profit.

- SINGLE TP % OF TRADE: Choose this option to move the trade to breakeven when a certain percentage level of the full position is reached. For example, if set to 30%, the trade will be moved to breakeven when it reaches 30% of the full trade size

inputs.name: Trigger B.E %
inputs.tooltip: The MOVE_BREAKEVEN_TRIGGER parameter represents the percentage level at which the trade should be moved to breakeven when using the SINGLE TP or SINGLE TP % OF TRADE logic. For example, if MOVE_BREAKEVEN_TRIGGER is set to 1.5, the trade will be moved to breakeven when it reaches a 1.5% profit from the entry line.

inputs.name: Wiggle room to cover commision - B.E %
inputs.tooltip: The MOVE_BREAKEVEN_WIGGLE parameter allows for a wiggle room to cover commissions when moving the trade to breakeven using the SINGLE TP or SINGLE TP % OF TRADE logic. It represents the percentage level of the trade size that will be added to the breakeven price to account for commissions. For example, if MOVE_BREAKEVEN_WIGGLE is set to 0.0, no additional wiggle room will be added.

inputs.name: Take Multi Profit X3
inputs.tooltip: This may only work on percentage. Depending on your API connector. WORKS WITH SIMPLEBOT

inputs.name: Level 1
inputs.tooltip: % to take at X TP = Percentage of portfolio to remove from trade, Level X = at what percentage to take that profit? BE AWARE this can fake or make your strategy look better than it truly is in tradingview.

inputs.name: Level 2
inputs.tooltip: % to take at X TP = Percentage of portfolio to remove from trade, Level X = at what percentage to take that profit? BE AWARE this can fake or make your strategy look better than it truly is in tradingview.

inputs.name: Level 3
inputs.tooltip: % to take at X TP = Percentage of portfolio to remove from trade, Level X = at what percentage to take that profit? BE AWARE this can fake or make your strategy look better than it truly is in tradingview.

inputs.name: ATR length
inputs.tooltip: Length of the period for the ATR to average

inputs.name: Use Moving Averages?
inputs.tooltip: Sets the moving average type for the first MA

inputs.name: MA Type #1
inputs.tooltip: Sets the moving average type for the first MA

inputs.name: MA Type #2
inputs.tooltip: Sets the moving average type for the second MA

inputs.name: MA Type #3
inputs.tooltip: Sets the moving average type for the first MA

inputs.name: MA Type #4
inputs.tooltip: Sets the moving average type for the second MA

inputs.name: MA Type #5
inputs.tooltip: Sets the moving average type for the first MA

inputs.name: MA Length #1
inputs.tooltip: Sets the length for the first MA. (it is likely best to keep MA1 length less than MA2, or it may result in opposite trade bias desired depending on MA type

inputs.name: MA Length #2
inputs.tooltip: Sets the length for the second MA. (it is likely best to keep MA2 length greater than MA2, or it may result in opposite trade bias desired depending on MA type

inputs.name: MA Length #3
inputs.tooltip: Sets the length for the first MA. (it is likely best to keep MA1 length less than MA2, or it may result in opposite trade bias desired depending on MA type

inputs.name: MA Length #4
inputs.tooltip: Sets the length for the first MA. (it is likely best to keep MA1 length less than MA2, or it may result in opposite trade bias desired depending on MA type

inputs.name: MA Length #5
inputs.tooltip: Sets the length for the first MA. (it is likely best to keep MA1 length less than MA2, or it may result in opposite trade bias desired depending on MA type

inputs.name: HMA Length
inputs.tooltip: Sets the length for the first MA. (it is likely best to keep MA1 length less than MA2, or it may result in opposite trade bias desired depending on MA type

inputs.name: Enable Max Trades?
inputs.tooltip: Enable this option to set a maximum number of trades in one direction.

inputs.name: Max Trades Per Direction?
inputs.tooltip: Set the maximum number of trades allowed in one direction. For example, if MAX = 5, only 5 long trades in a row will be allowed. The trading bot will then be paused until a short trade occurs.

inputs.name: NFP
inputs.tooltip:
Data from 9 Nov 2021  to 3 Jan 2024.  The FOMC meets eight times a year to determine monetary policy. Decisions are announced in a press release at 2:15 p.m. ET, followed by a press conference at 2:30 p.m. ET. They consider economic and financial developments to assess their impact on the economic outlook.

FOMC minutes are released three weeks after each meeting, providing a detailed account of discussions and assessments of economic developments.
The Producer Price Index (PPI) measures price changes of goods and services by domestic producers. It's a weighted average of prices in various sectors, serving as a leading indicator for CPI.

The Consumer Price Index (CPI) measures price changes of goods and services purchased by households. CPI-U, based on a sample of 87,000 urban households, is widely used to gauge inflation.

The University of Michigan's Consumer Sentiment Index (CSI) surveys 500 U.S. households monthly to gauge consumer attitudes about the economy, serving as a leading indicator for consumer spending.

The Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index (CCI) surveys 5,000 U.S. households monthly to measure consumer attitudes about the economy, also serving as a leading indicator for consumer spending.

The Non-Farm Payroll (NFP) measures changes in employment, excluding farm and government workers. It's a leading indicator for consumer spending.

inputs.name: Close X MINUTES before event
inputs.tooltip: This is the number of MINUTES the bot will be paused for before the event, allow one candle for the close.

inputs.name: Pause for X MINUTES after event
inputs.tooltip: This is the number of MINUTES the bot will be paused for after the event.

inputs.name: RSI Strategy
inputs.tooltip:
Standard RSI : When RSI is more than Overbrought SHORT. When RSI is less than Oversold LONG.
 Standard + MA : If RSI is more than MA LONG If RSI is less than MA SHORT. 
 Standard + MA Strict : RSI MA cross must happen in the Oversold or Overbrought areas. 
 Please try the reversed version as sometimes results can be suprising.

inputs.name: Enable  Hurst exponent ?
inputs.tooltip:
The Hurst exponent is a mathematical concept used to assess the predictability of a time series data. It is particularly employed in financial analysis to identify whether a market is trending, experiencing consolidation, or following a random walk pattern.

The Hurst exponent measures the long-term memory or persistence of a time series. It ranges from 0 to 1, where values above 0.5 indicate a trending market, values below 0.5 suggest a mean-reverting or consolidating market, and a value of 0.5 implies a random walk pattern.

inputs.name: Use Rate of Change?
inputs.tooltip: The Rate of Change indicator (ROC) is a momentum oscillator. It calculates the percent change in plotOfPrice between periods. If possitive it will take an entry.

inputs.name: ADX Timeframe (BETA)
inputs.tooltip:
Tradingview data is pulled from higher time frames, this can cause repainting and is not always relyable in backtesting. Please be careful. 
 MTF may also cause trades to be triggered late.

inputs.name: MFI Timeframe (BETA)
inputs.tooltip:
Tradingview data is pulled from higher time frames, this can cause repainting and is not always relyable in backtesting. Please be careful.
 MTF may also cause trades to be triggered late.

inputs.name: Use Rate of Change?
inputs.tooltip: The Rate of Change indicator (ROC) is a momentum oscillator. It calculates the percent change in plotOfPrice between periods. If possitive it will take an entry.

inputs.name: FM Timeframe (BETA)
inputs.tooltip:
Tradingview data is pulled from higher time frames, this can cause repainting and is not always relyable in backtesting. Please be careful.
 MTF may also cause trades to be triggered late.

inputs.name: VF Timeframe (BETA)
inputs.tooltip:
Tradingview data is pulled from higher time frames, this can cause repainting and is not always relyable in backtesting. Please be careful.
 MTF may also cause trades to be triggered late.

inputs.name: Enable Bull Bear Power?
inputs.tooltip: Use the Bull Bear Power indicator for confluence. If BBP is above 0 confirm LONG. If BBP is below 0 confirm shorts

inputs.name: BBP Timeframe (BETA)
inputs.tooltip:
Tradingview data is pulled from higher time frames, this can cause repainting and is not always relyable in backtesting. Please be careful.
 MTF may also cause trades to be triggered late.

inputs.name: Active Sessions & Week Days? (READ TOOLTIP)
inputs.tooltip:
To utilize the Week Days, Sessions, or Filters functionality in your trading strategy, you need to activate the USE_SESSIONS checkbox.

Enabling this option is necessary if you want your strategy to consider specific weekdays, trading sessions, or apply certain filters to optimize its performance.

Please ensure that you activate this checkbox if you intend to use any of the aforementioned features. Otherwise, you can leave it unchecked if you don't require these functionalities in your strategy

inputs.name: End of Session Close All Trades?
Use Date Filter for BackTeser (Active Above)
inputs.tooltip: Turns on/off time session filter

inputs.name: Start Filter
inputs.tooltip: Start date & time to begin backtest period. Also useful for beginning new bot. eg. Set time to now to make broker emulator in a flat position before setting alerts

inputs.name: End Filter
inputs.tooltip: End date & time to stop searching for setups for back testing.

inputs.name: Alert Frequency
inputs.tooltip:
Select the frequency at which alerts are triggered.

Note: This setting is specifically designed for manual trading purposes.

inputs.name: Use Immediately?
inputs.tooltip: Immediately An optional parameter. If true, the closing order will be executed on the tick where it has been placed, ignoring the strategy parameters that restrict the order execution to the open of the next bar. The default is false.

inputs.name: LIVE TRADING 🏄
inputs.tooltip: This feature is crucial for implementing your trading strategy in a live environment. By specifying the Live Trading Start Date, the system will calculate the margin requirements and performance metrics from this specific date onwards. Additionally, it enables accurate forward testing by recording and analyzing results starting from the specified date. Make sure to set the Live Trading Start Date appropriately to align with your desired trading approach and historical data analysis. Explainer video on www.trigger.trade.

inputs.name: STARTING DATE
inputs.tooltip: Enter the date you began live trading. You can drag and drop after. Explainer video on www.trigger.trade.

inputs.name: Use Simple Bot?
inputs.tooltip: This is the simplest way of connecting tradingview to bots, I suggest watching the video on the trigger.trade website. Each system has it's own limits and risks.

inputs.name: Use Saftey SL
inputs.tooltip:
This will add conditional a limit TP & SL to your exchange. 
 This means the TP/SL are set in stone. 
 Please note this may change the way your strategy works. For example, ignore wicks will not work with this function.

inputs.name: Telegram Channel ID
inputs.tooltip: Receive messages via telegram. There is an explainer video on trigger.trade

Show Entry/SL/TP
inputs.tooltip: Shows the trade entry level

inputs.name: Show Labels
inputs.tooltip: Shows the trade entry level

inputs.name: Show trail trigger plotOfPrice
inputs.tooltip: Shows the level that the trailing stop is triggered

inputs.name: Calculate Strategy on every Tick(s)
inputs.tooltip: Recalculates the strategy with each real-time bar update

inputs.name: Calculate Strategy on Order's Fill(s)
inputs.tooltip: Triggers an additional intrabar calculation after order fills

inputs.name: Default entry/order Qty Type
inputs.tooltip: Quantity per trade in the selected unit

inputs.name: pyramiding
inputs.tooltip: Maximum number of successive entries allowed in the same direction

inputs.name: Commission Type
inputs.tooltip: Entry and exit fees to be paid

inputs.name: Backtesting slippage for market orders
inputs.tooltip: Ticks to be added to the fill price of market and stop orders

inputs.name: Base Currency
inputs.tooltip: Currency used in calculations and strategy results

inputs.name: Initial Capital
inputs.tooltip: Starting funds available for the trading strategy

inputs.name: Backtesting Limit Order(s) fill assumption
inputs.tooltip: Ticks beyond the limit price required for limit order execution

inputs.name: Process orders on bar Close
inputs.tooltip: Fills market orders on the close of the bar where they are issued

inputs.name: Margin Long
inputs.tooltip: Percentage of the long position the strategy must fund from equity

inputs.name: Margin Short
inputs.tooltip: Percentage of the short position the strategy must fund from equity

inputs.name: Alert message template for run mode 'alert'
Use Bar Magnifier
inputs.tooltip: On historical bars, uses more precise lower timeframe prices for more realistic results

inputs.name: Fill orders using standard OHLC
inputs.tooltip: Forces strategies running on Heikin Ashi charts to fill orders using actual OHLC prices, for more realistic results
